sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: French voters go to the polls to choose who will control their National Assembly in the second round of parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The end of the war in Ukraine could take years, the NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg has warned, adding we must not stop supporting Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands of hectares of forest have been consumed by pre-summer wildfires in Spain,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: as temperatures reached 10 degrees higher than normal in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The French head to the polls today to cast their vote in the second round of its parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron's Ensemble movement will be hoping to fend off the surging challenge from the newly formed left-wing movement, NOUes, led by Jean-Luc Mélenchon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The left-left wave is one of concern for Macron, with Ensemble only collecting 21,000 more votes than Noupes in last week's first round, which saw a record abstention rate, with many French people disenchanted with the political establishment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The French are not very mobilized. They have hopes annoyed by everything that happens, dissatisfied with the people in power. I don't know. Me, I voted both times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Noops' success in the first round is a real headache for Macron, who looks less likely to retain a majority in government and which could curtail his plans to push through his election promises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Early voting rates suggest turnout is slightly higher than last week's first round, with midday turnout figures standing at 19 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Polling closes at 8 p.m. French time, with an exit poll expected shortly after.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: JENS STOLTENBERG, NATO Secretary General, The end of the war in Ukraine could take years, according to the NATO Secretary General.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Jens Stoltenberg also said we must not stop supporting Ukraine as the war nears its fourth month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On the front line, Ukrainian troops speak of fatigue among the Russian army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We can say that in the last week there has been a stabilization of the front line in which the enemy is exhausted and cannot continue offensive operations it also cannot continue the offensive actions due to professional and high quality work of our artillery five civilians were killed and 12 injured in the eastern separatist city of donetsk pro-russian separatists say ukrainian forces were shelling the region for a third day in a row and that residents were called to stay in shelters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Donetsk has been partially controlled by Russian separatists since 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Kharkiv, the Ukrainian military said they have found 103 bodies in territories de-occupied by Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The bodies, believed to be of Russian troops, are to be kept at a storage facility in order to be exchanged with the bodies of Ukrainian soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Over in the southern port city of Odessa, President Volodymyr Zelensky presented state awards to border guards as he visited troops on Saturday, saying he wanted to thank them for the heroic work they have been doing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands of hectares of forest have been consumed by pre-summer wildfires in Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 1,700 people had to be evacuated from a number of different villages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Zamora, local authorities said an area equivalent to 50,000 football fields turned to ashes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Officials said the blaze in the Sierra de Culebra mountains near the Portuguese border started Wednesday during a dry electric storm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Temperatures of more than 40 degrees Celsius have been recorded in many parts of Spain throughout the week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As the World Meteorological Organization warns temperatures have been 10 degrees above normal in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I think this heatwave is very alarming. We can see climate change's consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We must find solutions for the future. We can't keep on like this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We can't keep on like this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a country associated with alpine weather and snowy peaks, Switzerland is also swattering in this early heat wave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: With temperatures well above 30 degrees Celsius, the Swiss National Weather Service found differences in temperatures between cities and the countryside were as high as 6 degrees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Germany, 36.4 degrees Celsius was measured in the upper Rhine region hot weather alerts were kept in place in the Heinlein Palatine as well as the Baden-Württemberg regions Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro led thousands of motorcyclists on a campaign ride through the Amazonian city of Manaus without wearing a helmet the visit happens days after the recovering of the remains of British journalist Tom Phillips and indigenous expert Bruno Pereira from the Amazon forest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Bolsonaro has been criticised for failing to show compassion in the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A passenger ferry service from Greece to Cyprus set sail again on Sunday for the first time in 21 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Over 170 passengers left the Greek port of Piraeus on the MV Dalila bound for Limassol on the 30-hour crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This summer the Cypriot-flagged ferry is scheduled to sail over 20 times both ways. It will be able to take over 400 passengers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Finally the umbilical cord that united Cyprus with Greece is re-established in a more efficient way with more modern ships. But most importantly, the opportunity is finally given to the many citizens who wanted it so much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Although it's not expected to be profitable and will have to receive subsidies, it's already had over 6,000 bookings, double what was expected. The ship has a sleeping capacity of 290 in its cabins, and for entertainment there are bars, cafes, restaurants and a casino.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Israel's Minister of Transport, Merav Mikhaeli, has said he'd be interested in the service also docking at an Israeli port.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The service will now run until September 16th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Portuguese artist Ana Moura, who's performed alongside Prince and the Rolling Stones, is to release her first original album in six years this September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The 42-year-old singer, who recently became a mother, told Euronews her new record was inspired by her newborn daughter and her own Angolan roots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The album is being released at the end of the summer in September, but the name hasn't been revealed yet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's a very special record for me, that's why it has taken a long time to come out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the meantime, I had a child and wanted to wait to have more availability for when the record is released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ana Moura said this track about her baby daughter was shaped by the Angolan music that she listened to as a child.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I grew up surrounded by Angolan music.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: My parents always listened to a lot of music at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They played and sang.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: music at home. They played and sang.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And I grew up in this very musical environment with various genres being played.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Performing here at Lyon's Nuit de Fourvière, Ana Moura says her new work is influenced by Portugal's traditional fado, a melancholic folk style.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The track has both fado and mineo elements because I also have roots there as my father is from the north of Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But then you have Jacaranda and Akara Vem Mim, which have the rhythm and sensuality of Angola's Kizomba.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And this new track is a tribute to a good friend who passed away in 2016.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I write Jacaranda for Prince. It's a tribute to him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Prince loved my music, but he said, your music just needs a beat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And that's how the beat actually came into this piece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think he would be very happy. France and Hungary throughout the summer.
